info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:07PM MDT until June 30 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM MDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PROWERS AND NORTHERN BENT COUNTIES... At 559 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over John Martin Reservoir, or 25 miles west of Lamar, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. Copious amounts of hail could accumulate on roadways creating slippery conditions. SOURCE...Radar indicated. This storm has have a history of producing severe wind gusts. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Hasty, McClave, Wiley and Lamar. This storm is expected to impact the Lamar area after 630 PM. This storm will impact portions of U.S. Highway 50. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Due to the strong outflow winds, blowing dust is possible, and could rapidly reduce visibilities. If on or near John Martin Reservoir, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
